edu.jhu.cs.oose.fall2014.shuffletter.iface

Interface ShuffletterModel


  • public interface ShuffletterModel
    The interface describing the behavior of a Shuffletter game model. A correct submission for the first part of this assignment includes a class which implements this interface.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListener(ShuffletterModelListener listener)
      Adds an event listener to this model.
      void endRound()
      Used to indicate that the player wishes to end the current round.

      Retrieves the name of the author of this model.
      int getBagCount()
      Determines the number of tiles in the bag.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getLegalWords()
      Retrieves the set of legal words that this model is using.
      java.util.List<ShuffletterTile> getSupplyContents()
      Retrieves the collection of tiles currently in the supply.

      Retrieves the tile at the provided position in the playing grid.

    • Method Detail

      • getAuthorName

        java.lang.String getAuthorName()
        Retrieves the name of the author of this model.

      • getLegalWords

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getLegalWords()
        Retrieves the set of legal words that this model is using.
        Returns:
        The set of all legal words for this model.

      • getTilePositions

        java.util.Collection<Position> getTilePositions()
        Obtains a collection of positions at which letter pieces appear on the playing grid.

      • getTile

        ShuffletterTile getTile(Position p)
        Retrieves the tile at the provided position in the playing grid.
        Parameters:
        p - The position at which the tile is located.
        Returns:
        The tile at that position or null if there is no tile there.

      • getSupplyContents

        java.util.List<ShuffletterTile> getSupplyContents()
        Retrieves the collection of tiles currently in the supply.
        Returns:
        The tiles currently in the supply.

      • getBagCount

        int getBagCount()
        Determines the number of tiles in the bag.
        Returns:
        The number of tiles in the bag.

      • isGameOver

        boolean isGameOver()
        Determines whether or not the game is over.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over; false if it is not.

      • move

        void move(Position source,
        Position target)
        Used to indicate that a tile should be moved from one location on the playing grid to another. Whether the move is legal or illegal, an appropriate event is raised. If the target location is occupied, then the source and target positions should be swapped.
        Parameters:
        source - The current position of the tile.
        target - The new position for that tile.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided source position does not contain a tile.

      • play

        void play(ShuffletterTile tile,
        Position target)
        Used to indicate that a tile in the supply should be moved to the playing grid. Whether the move is legal or illegal, an appropriate event is raised. Illegal moves include playing a tile to an occupied position.
        Parameters:
        tile - The supply tile to move.
        target - The new position for that tile.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the provided tile does not exist in the supply.

      • endRound

        void endRound()
        Used to indicate that the player wishes to end the current round. Whether the move is legal or illegal, an appropriate event is raised. Ending the round is illegal, for instance, when the tiles are not touching or when words on the board are not correctly spelled.

      • addListener

        void addListener(ShuffletterModelListener listener)
        Adds an event listener to this model.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to add.

      • removeListener

        void removeListener(ShuffletterModelListener listener)
        Removes an event listener from this model.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to remove.
